fields.description:
It would be great to being able to define - per project or based or even per any project branch matching a regex - a list of custom tasks to add to any new PR.

A typical use case is to have a task to remind developers to execute some actions before merging.

In our scenario, we have scripts that when a <release-notes> section is added to a merge commit than automatically create the release notes to distribute with the build (e.g. in fabric). But quite often we do forget to add that when we merge! Having a task would be a sort of reminder for us and we would check it just before merging.
fields.summary: Possibility to define default custom tasks to be added to new PRs

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

1. Go to the branches page in a repository
2. Type a search term in the branch filter text field
3. Wait for results to return
h3. Expected result

Branch list is filtered and the search field retains focus so that additional filtering can be done immediately.
h3. Actual result

Branch list is filtered, however the search field loses focus.
fields.summary: Filter branch Text Field loses focus when searching for branches

fields.description:
Would it be possible to get a hovering indication on top of the pull request's overview page with the file name of the currently viewed file?

When I'm doing code reviews I often find myself scrolling up and down just to see the name of the file I'm reviewing (ok, I know, files shouldn't be that long, but lets say I have a small screen :)).

 

Thanks,

Marko
fields.summary: Show currently viewed file on the pull request overview

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When merging a pull request in the web UI, there's an option to "Delete source branch after merging". This calls a second, undocumented resource to handle the deletion of the source ref and the retargeting of any dependent PR's that had been targeting the source ref.

When merging a PR via the [\{repositorySlug\}/pull-requests/\{pullRequestId\}/merge|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.11.1/bitbucket-rest.html#idm46358290910576] resource, there is no equivalent option to delete the source ref. The pull-request-cleanup resource that can do this is undocumented, and therefore isn't safe for clients to use.
 
 h3. Suggested Solution
 Provide a {{deleteSourceRef}} option in *\{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/\{pullRequestId}*

/merge
h3. Workaround

Use the internal resource to clean up PR's after merging (not recommended).
fields.summary: REST API: Provide option to allow deletion of source branch after merging a PR
Bitbucket should have a REST API that tells us the last commit for a given pull request id

fields.description:
When I make a bunch of code review comments on a pull request, Bitbucket represents them all as individual comments with no connection to each other. They also get sent out as individual notification emails.

It’d be much nicer if the comments were grouped as part of a single “review” and sent out in a single email. This would help the pull request author see all my comments in context and vastly reduce the email volume for other people watching the pull request.

(There is an option to batch emails by only sending them out once every 30 minutes, but that introduces a pretty large delay into code review iteration.)
fields.summary: Would like to batch code review comments into a single review and notification email

fields.description: Currently there appears to be no way to create a custom merge driver in global or system gitconfig files that is not ignored by Bitbucket. As merge drivers are a fairly core component of some git workflows the ability to define them at any level would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Support for Merge Drivers

fields.description:
When I open all files, I want to see all files with comments, but with this icon, I can't see my comments. These icons merge. 

!image-2018-07-04-11-47-36-420.png!
fields.summary: Please change icon files, when file have comments
Directory sync fails if display_name is NULL for a user

fields.description: When I update my own pull request and people who have already approved it auto-unapprove, I don't really need that notification being sent to my email inbox. Would be nice if I could turn that off.
fields.summary: Customise email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Bitbucket Server and Data Center CloudFormation templates don't contain the options for the newest AWS EC2 instance types.

For example {{c5.\*}} instance types are not included, while {{c3.\*}} are provided.

EDIT: {{r5.\*}} instance types are not included either. Please update the CloudFormation template to allow picking of these instance types too. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the CloudFormation templates for both Server and Data Center to provide the option to use the newest generation.
fields.summary: As an admin running Bitbucket Server on AWS, I would like the CloudFormation templates to be updated to add the newest Instance type generations

fields.description:
The version of jQuery bundled in Bitbucket server is affected by the CVE described below.

- https://www.cvedetails.com/cve/CVE-2015-9251/

bq.jQuery before 3.0.0 is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks when a cross-domain Ajax request is performed without the dataType option, causing text/javascript responses to be executed.
fields.summary: Update jQuery version bundled in Bitbucket.

fields.description:
hi,

you show developer daily activite like github. it is important for motivation. i want to use github for one reason of this. i want to see my daily performans. thank you.
fields.summary: yearly contribution graphic

fields.description:
We had a user point out that a PR that they opened was merged into master (which broke their build) because they didn't notice that the automation user (Samuel Lint Jackson) feedback wasn't prioritized.

1. Can we have a way to bubble/sort by priority (the green checkmarks kinda gave the wrong signals)
2. Can we badge the PR so that it's like a visual indicator some feedback wasn't Approved and they should possibly take a look
3. Perhaps the merge dialog should indicate the 'Needs Work' status, but allow the merge ('whatever you say') if the human chooses to ignore it.
fields.summary: Pull request feedback sort order hides needs work status

fields.description:
Hi

At [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/supported-platforms-776640981.html/]

link to [Installing and upgrading Git|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverm/installing-and-upgrading-git-883399975.html] is not accessible for non-Atlassians.

It should be changed from:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverm/installing-and-upgrading-git-883399975.html]

to:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/installing-and-upgrading-git-776640906.html]

Cheers
Tomasz Tokarczuk
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Supported Platforms Git upgrade link is broken

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a DiffContext using DiffContext.Builder and don't set a maxLineLength (or set it to something short).
 # Call a a diff command using that diff context

h3. Expected result:

Diff is streamed into callback like normal
h3. Actual result:

DiffOutputHandler fails reading diff header because the max line length is too short.
h3. Example:
{code:java}
scmService.getPullRequestCommandFactory(pullRequest)
        .diff(new PullRequestDiffCommandParameters.Builder().maxLineLength(100).build(), new AbstractDiffContentCallback(){});
{code}
h2. Workaround

Set the maxLine length to something long enough to read the full paths involved.
fields.summary: Diff command fails for long paths

fields.description:
h5. Summary

While navigating through “Reviewer” user lists in Pull Requests, users are no longer Highlighted/framed on selection.
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Pull Request
 # Add multiple users as “Reviewer”
 # While the “Reviewer” test box is still selected, use the left navigation arrow to select through the users already added.

h5. Expected Results

Some form of Highlight or frame to identify which username was currently selected should be visible.
Bitbucket 5.2.0 screenshot with user “user2” selected
 !bitbucket5-2-0.png|thumbnail!
h5. Actual Results

No way to identify which user is selected, or any that is noticeable.
Bitbucket 5.11.1 screenshot with user “michael” selected
 !bitbucket5-11-1.png|thumbnail!
h5. Workaround

None
fields.summary: UI: Selected "Reviewers" in Pull Requests is not highlighted

fields.description: As a user I would like to have the ability to see the Pull Requests that I have been mentioned in, even if i’m not listed as a reviewer of that pull request. Maybe a “mentioned” section could be added to My Pull Requests along with Reviewing and Created?
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have the ability to see the Pull Requests that I have been mentioned in, even if i’m not listed as a reviewer of that pull request.

fields.description:
It doesn't appear like there is any references to where a Webhook request originated from, e.g. the server url.

I would imagine that there is quite a few systems where this information would be useful, it is also something that both Bitbucket cloud and Github does.

I would very much like to see that included in Bitbucket server as well.
fields.summary: Include source details in webhooks

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page. The new page has no problems with misaligned side-by-side diffs.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

================================
0. make sure you are in side-by-side diff view
1. when it is open, ctrl+g and type fdevice.
2. press enter a few times to just go through the searches.
3. alignment is off by a lot
================================
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff view code highlights get out of sync with an in-page keyword search

fields.description: I would like the option to see my branches on my dashboard because it will be easier to make a PR from the UI and it will help me remember to close branches that I've stopped working on.
fields.summary: View branches on dashboard

fields.description:
Calling {{/rest/api/1.0/projects/KEY/repos/slug/pull-requests/1/diff}} without passing a path in the URL can return multiple elements in the "diffs" array. From a diff perspective, everything appears to work correctly (although the diff may be truncated if it hits the 10,000 line hard limit imposed by the system). However, if the diff includes _comments_, they're not handled correctly in two ways:

* The {{"fileComments"}} and/or {{"lineComments"}} array is duplicated at the end of every diff
* The paths on the comments are not considered when deciding whether to attach a comment to a given line in the diff
fields.summary: The pull request diff REST endpoint handles comments incorrectly when a path is not provided

fields.description:
You now have support for Git LFS but not for Mecurial LFS.

It would be awesome if this could be added on. Surely it's just a minor variation?

Not only would this be terribly useful for your clients, also the large files aspect provides you with a useful source of revenue.
fields.summary: Hg LFS

fields.description: While discussing BSERV-10951, we noticed that errors during branch deletion like a 500 or a 404, where the response returns an array of errors in the JSON body, will be doubly shown in an error dialog and a flag.
fields.summary: Branch deletion likely double handles some kinds of errors

fields.description:
These are handled using the default red error dialog. One alternative is to match what branch deletion does and show an error AUI flag.

Tag deletion veto:

!tag-deletion-canceled.png!

Branch deletion veto:

!branch-deletion-canceled.png!
fields.summary: Tag deletion UI doesn't handle vetoes

fields.description:
Bitbucket treats any text that follows the Jira standard (ABC-123, etc) as a link.

 

Bitbucket should verify that that the project key and issue actually exists before creating the link.
fields.summary: BitBucket Server should validate potential JIRA links

fields.description:
Dear team,

 

we wanted to purchase Bitbucket server version for 10 users but we wanted to have some clarity so please anyone can chate us ? or anny one can conact us on my phone (+91) 9004299444.
fields.summary: Wanted to purchase but confused
Server Unreachable when adding a group that exceeds license limit

fields.description:
Bitbucket documentation provides requirements or guidelines for the filesystem space required for the database and repositories storage.
However, there are no guidelines on how to estimate the filesystem space required from cache and tmp directories located in Bitbucket home directory.
fields.summary: Provide the filesystem requirements documentation  for tmp and cache directories

fields.description:
It would be nice to set environment variables on project or plan level for bamboo specs plans without configuring the values of the variables in the code / yaml file.

Possible use case:
Pushing built docker container to an docker repo and passing login credentials for this repo via environment variables.
fields.summary: Project and plan specific variables for bamboo specs

fields.description: fatal: unable to access 'https://cherrishccl@bitbucket.org/oxchains/themis.git/': OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443
fields.summary: How can I resolve this problem，please?

fields.description: https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.18.0.txt
fields.summary: Support for Git 2.18

fields.description:
Within our corporate environment we have both GitHub Enterprise and Bitbucket Datacenter instances.  As a result we often receive requests for feature parity between the two.  In this case I have a team requesting an iPython viewer similar to the one in GitHub.  The problem is that the only one available in the marketplace is unsupported and not verified.  Due to the size of our environment we cannot install a plugin that is in this state.  Is there any way this functionality could be included natively within BitBucket?

 

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215217/ipython-notebook-plugin?hosting=server&tab=overview
fields.summary: Built in iPython viewer request
Special formatting characters should be ignored in automatically converted URLs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Running on unsupported platforms can cause issues that may not be immediate to be identified by the instance administrator and/or a support engineer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a mechanism to highlight instances running on unsupported platforms.

Possible ideas/interim solutions:
- add NFS mount options to Support Zip
fields.summary: Running on unsupported platforms can cause issues that may not be immediate to be identified by the instance administrator and/or a support engineer

fields.description:
When searching for a repo name, one must often wade through a zillion results to find out if there is a match, because matches in the source code are returned in arbitrary order with the repo name matches, if there are any

I envision 2 good options for resolving this issue:
 # Allow option to search for ONLY repo names or ONLY source code.
 # Sort repo name matches to the top of the search results
fields.summary: When searching, repo name matches should not be interspersed with source code matches

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When vetoing tag creation using [RepositoryHookResult.Builder.veto|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/javadoc/5.1.0/api/reference/com/atlassian/bitbucket/hook/repository/RepositoryHookResult.Builder.html], the veto message provided by the app is not displayed in the UI. Instead, all the UI shows is "Tag creation canceled", with no details on _why_.
h3. Suggested Solution

The UI should display the veto messages provided when the request was canceled. (Additionally, it would be ideal if the veto messages could be formatted; see BSERV-4428 and BSERV-10910)
h3. Why this is important

This allows app developers the ability to display context-rich responses/reasoning behind vetoing/canceling tag creation.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Tag creation does not display vetos when canceled

fields.description:
h2. Summary Using something that looks like a Jira issue key in a link label or a link shortcut (i.e. {{[link label]([http://example.com|http://example.com/])}}, {{[label][link shortcut]}}) will render the wrong markup. h2. Link shortcuts In a markdown comment / document, let the string pattern in the shortcut reference link match the text in the body {noformat} [Rendering][ASB-1-comment] ASB-5 and ASB-7 [ASB-1-comment]: http://example.org/ {noformat} h3. Expected result {noformat} Rendering ASB-5 and ASB-7 {noformat} h3. Actual result Note that any reference to {{ASB-7}} is gone and there is now a link to {{ASB-1}} and {{ASB-5}}. {noformat} Rendering ASB-1 and ASB-5 {noformat} the markup markup {code:xml}

Rendering

ASB-1 and ASB-5

{code} h2. Link labels In a markdown comment / document, let the string pattern in the link label match a Jira issue {noformat} [ASB-3][ASB-1-comment] [ASB-1-comment]: http://example.org/ {noformat} h3. Expected result {code:xml}

ASB-3

{code} h3. Actual result {code:xml}

ASB-3

{code} h2. Workaround Use different string pattern in the body of the shortcut reference link.
fields.summary: Using something that looks like a Jira issue key in a link label or shortcut renders wrong markup

fields.description: Why are forced to see the pride flag logo? Why is Atlassian spreading some political agenda of a particular group? This is supposed to be professional tool, not a forum for spreading politics!
fields.summary: Pride logo.

fields.description:
h3. Scenario
 # Alice creates pull-request for branch X->master consisting of commits A, B, C - pull-request is delayed on comments from Bob
 # Bob creates branch Y from branch Y consisting A, B, C, D, E - which address an issue that is out of scope for Alice, but affects Bob
 # Bob has branch Y -> master reviewed and is accepted. BoB uses the "Rebase" merge method to close the pull-request - master thus has A', B', C', D', E'
 # Alice's pull-request x->Y now has a conflict and must be declined - the Rebase button is greyed out

Now `git rebase` can actually resolve this case just fine. Rebasing X onto master will result in master.

Inability to merge without conflicts is not a good proxy for whether rebasing will succeed.
h3. Suggested change

If the Rebase button were replaced with a button such as "Attempt rebase anyway" bitbucket would notice that the result of the rebase was a resolved merge-request.

I understand this is something that is perhaps better addressed by workflow or process, it just that `git rebase` can make some freakishly good decisions, and it can be frustrating when bitbucket isn't quite as trusting of git.

By the way - thanks for the new rebase merge method
fields.summary: Allow rebase to be attempted even with merge conflicts

fields.description:
When a request (e.g. a REST request on a pull request page) fails, for example if it is aborted, an error dialog is intended to be shown with a message. However only the overlay is shown and the dialog does not show at all, with the only workaround being to refresh the page.

  !https://content.screencast.com/media/d39b7adb-b3c6-40cf-b375-dba1b11a2056_293c3d78-bf1d-4d51-becd-e53646a12bfd_static_0_0_2018-06-21_13-36-05.png!
fields.summary: An aborted request that shows an error dialog normally causes an overlay with no dialog

fields.description:
I have users who want to create webhooks to connect to local Jenkins and has requested to install Webhooks to Jenkins for Bitbucket on our Bitbucket instance,

 

 Can you confirm usage of the webhook, impact and rolback if needed before we install?
fields.summary: Atlassian webhooks connect to local jenkins

fields.description:
The error messages from failed Webhooks shouldn't be qualified as INFO as for some system Webhooks like Smart Mirror synchronization it can cause false impression that everything is working as expected.

It would be good to change the logging level to WARN as far for bundled webhooks.
fields.summary: Failed webhook message should be WARN instead of INFO

fields.description: When a custom Jira pattern is specified using {{-Dintegration.jira.key.pattern}}, it is not honored when the web UI generates issue links in commit messages (or other places). It is only honored by the commit indexer, which gathers the keys displayed in the "Issues" column.
fields.summary: The web UI does not honor custom Jira issue patterns

fields.description:
First, this request is specifically for Bitbucket Cloud. Sorry it's here, but CLOUD-10576.

I've been tasked with creating a tool that creates and updates pull requests via the rest api. I have since found that, while POST honors the description field, PUT does not. Our use case would be assisted greatly if PUT operations honored the description field. Plz halp.
fields.summary: Allow update of Pull Request description via PUT call

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If branch permission with backslash ( \ ) is mistakenly created, none of the existing branch permissions in the repository or project can be edited anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few branch permissions in the repository or project
 # Create a branch permission with pattern "release\" (backslash instead forward slash)
 # Save the setting
 It will take some time for the page to reload
 # Try to create a new or edit other branch permissions

h3. Expected Results
 # The incorrect branch permission with the pattern "release\" will not be saved
 # Can create and edit other branch permissions

h3. Actual Results
 # The incorrect branch permission with the pattern "release\" does not appear in the list but the database table "AO_6978BB_RESTRICTED_REF" have this setting
 # Can't create and edit other branch permissions
 # The below exception is thrown in the browser Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: tbody[data-branch-value="release\"][data-branch-type="PATTERN"][data-effective-scope-type="REPOSITORY"]
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 # Retrieve branch permissions via REST to find the ID (should be a number) of the offending permission:
 {code:java}curl -v -H "Accept:application/json" <USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<INSTANCE_URL>/rest/branch-permissions/latest/projects/<PROJECT_KEY>/repos/<REPO_SLUG>/restrictions/{code}
 If you have Python installed you can append the following to this command to make the output more readable:
 {code}| python -m json.tool{code}
 # Delete the offending permission via REST:
{code:java}
curl -v -X DELETE <USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<INSTANCE_URL>/rest/branch-permissions/latest/projects/<PROJECT_KEY>/repos/<REPO_SLUG>/restrictions/<PERMISSION_ID>
{code}
 # Verify the permission has been deleted by repeating step 1.
fields.summary: Branch permission pattern with backslash break the settings

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page. The new page has no problems with misaligned side-by-side diffs when you zoom-in or zoom-out.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}

h3. Summary
Side-by-side diff view gets misaligned (red and green highlights) with browser zoom-in and zoom-out operations. This is confirmed in Chrome and Firefox (Linux) and Safari (OS X) so far. See attached screenshot.

h3. How to reproduce
# Open up a pull request and click on a commit
# Choose side-by-side diff from the diff-view menu
# Zoom-in using browser controls and then zoom-out
# The highlight colours don't align accurately anymore

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff view gets misaligned if we zoom-in and then zoom-out using browser zoom controls

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bitbucket Server returns a 401 ("You are not permitted to view this page" error) on the dashboard when a user has recent pushes to repositories they no longer have access to.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a user (not a system admin) and give it permissions to a particular repository (or project)
 # Push to the repository as that user
 # Revoke permissions for the repository (or project) for this user
 # View the dashboard page

h3. Expected

Dashboard page loads correctly, with the recent pushes to the repository that the user no longer has access to filtered out.
h3. Actual

The dashboard page does not load correctly (a 401 error page is returned). Note that if you remain on the dashboard while permissions are revoked, the XHR request to pull request suggestions will throw a 401, but the page will still work.
fields.summary: Dashboard returns 401 when user loses permissions to repository recently pushed to

fields.description:
After upgrade Bitbucket Server to last 5.11.1 diff in PR's not show in Firefox & Edge. Chrome shows diff fine.

Checked on Linux & Windows desktops.

 

P.S.: Can't insert screenshot & also can't create bug issue type.
fields.summary: 5.11.1: PR diffs is empty if Firefox

fields.description:
I have my own Jenkins server and I want to do "git push" to my Bitbucket repo using ssh keys.

when I go to Bitbucket web site to create an ssh key, I see it requires Pipelines to be enabled, which means adding a pipeline yaml file and so on. I don't want to use Pipelines for this project.

are you planning to support ssh keys with access control per repository?

I want to create several ssh keys and define permissions per repo and per Jenkins job type, e.g. "ssh key for REPO x with PUSH permission"
fields.summary: support ssh keys without requiring Pipelines

fields.description:
Lets say I want to review some pull requests. Even though I can filter through pull requests that are Open, I would like the ability to filter those that are Open AND not yet approved. This will allow me to focus on pull requests that need most attention. I would expect this filter option to be alongside the other filtering options in the /pull-requests endpoint of a repository.

The use case is as follows:

The *entire* team is encouraged to review pull requests. This involves reviewing pull requests that you are not a “reviewer” on. In other words, the trigger for enabling a team member to review should not be limited to adding them as a reviewer.

The way to empower this culture is to show all pull requests that haven’t been approved yet.
fields.summary: Ability to filter pull requests by not yet approved.

fields.description:
When a repository is forked, the system reconfigures it to facilitate the use of Git alternates to minimize the increase in disk space usage. However, if concurrent requests are made to fork the same repository, some of them may fail due to Git locking the forked repository's configuration to apply those updates.

To prevent such random-appearing failures, the system should implement some form of locking so concurrent requests either wait or simply skip the reconfiguration altogether (since it only needs to be applied once anyway).
fields.summary: Harden fork creation to handle concurrent requests

fields.description:
Since Bitbucket Server 5.4.0, where the JIRA Guaranteed Delivery feature was implemented, it is possible for exhaustion in the ExecutorService threadpool to propagate to the event threadpool, possibly causing the event queue to overflow.

A system impacted by this would see all its event threads blocked with this stack:
{noformat}
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000004492e9ac8> (a java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.awaitDone(FutureTask.java:429)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.jira.index.DefaultJiraIndexService.updateIssueActivity(DefaultJiraIndexService.java:382)
{noformat}
fields.summary: DefaultJiraIndexService.updateIssueActivity() event thread exhaustion

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When hovering your cursor over a commit, a text box is created in a location that sometimes overlaps with the commit message. This allows you to move your cursor to a place that overlaps with both causing a loop where the hover text appears, causing you to mouse off of the commit link, which causes the text box to disappear, looping back to you hovering over the commit message triggering the hover text box to reappear.
This sets in motion an infinite loop of the box appearing and disappearing.

This primarily occurs with long commit messages, or when the Bitbucket UI is reduced in size.

h3. Environment
* Chrome/Firefox/Safari/IE

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hover over commit messages with either a very long message or a small window size
# If commit message hover text appears in a place overlapping the current commit message link, move your cursor to a position of the overlap

h3. Expected Results
Commit Hover text does not overlap

h3. Actual Results
Loop of Hover text appearing and disappearing with a strobe-like effect
fields.summary: Commit Hover Text Placement

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User Interface behavior is different between the "Created" tab and the "Reviewing" tab of your personal Pull-Request dropdown panel.

The "Reviewing" tab's list does not scroll and the panel will grow to the needed size (up to a maximum size based on window size) to view all PRs concurrently whereas the "Created" tab panel will stop at a max of 7 and then gain a scrollbar. 
In the case of large amounts of PRs in both tabs, You can scroll through and see all "Created" PRs but you will be unable to list all "Reviewing" PRs.
h3. Environment
 * Chrome/Firefox/Safari/IE

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a long list (more than 7) "Created" Pull-Requests
 # Have a long list (more than 7) "Reviewing" Pull-Requests

h3. Expected Results

Both "Reviewing" and "Created" tabs should have scroll bars to review long lists.
h3. Actual Results

"Created" tab works as expected but "Reviewing" tab grows indefinitely.
fields.summary: Reviewing vs Created PR Dropdown panels behave differently

fields.description:
By default, if I click on default branch (master), I see all recent branches sorted by date of last commit.

But when I start searching for specific branch (for example, all my branches start with nickname), Bitbucket sorts these branches by name.

I think adding an option like "in which order to sort branches in search results" would be a good idea.
fields.summary: Sort branches in search results by date of last commit

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a DiffContext using DiffContext.Builder and don't set a maxLineLength (or set it to something short).
 # Call a a diff command using that diff context

h3. Expected result:

Diff is streamed into callback like normal
h3. Actual result:

DiffOutputHandler fails reading the hunk header because the max line length is too short.
h3. Example:
{code:java}
scmService.getPullRequestCommandFactory(pullRequest)
        .diff(new PullRequestDiffCommandParameters.Builder().maxLineLength(0).build(), new AbstractDiffContentCallback(){});
{code}
h2. Workaround

Set the maxLine length to something long enough to read the header hunks
fields.summary: Diff command fails if DiffContext.maxLineLength is not set

fields.description:
As of Bitbucket Server 5.9.0, we no longer provide customized messages during the password reset dialog when a user is managed by an external read-only directory, like Jira. BSERV-10581 Now we provide only a generic message that "If you are a registered user you will receive a password reset e-mail." For users in read-only directories, this results in no action at all. This is confusing to the user because they may be waiting for an e-mail that never comes instead of talking to the administrator that can actually help them and results in lost productivity.

Since we can no longer provide guidance in the messaging to direct the user to the right place to get help based on the directory type, it would be beneficial to be able to at least have the option to remove the password reset function altogether for external users so as not to provide confusing messages.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the option to remove "Reset Password" option when using Jira for user management

fields.description:
Using Bitbucket server with the "Repository setting -> Pull Requests -> Unapprove automatically on new changes" checkbox checked.

This causes approved pull requests to be unapproved automatically when new changes are pushed, thus preventing changed that are not reviewed to be merged.

 

However, when changes are not pushed, but edited online in Bitbucket Server, this setting is ignored. This is problematic because it allows for merging unapproved changes.

 

version: 
 * Atlassian Bitbucket v5.5.0
fields.summary: "Unapprove automatically" is ignored when editing a pull request online

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Bitbucket provides only Docker packages however there is not support for deploying Bitbucket in Kubernetes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bitbucket should be provided as [HELM chart|https://docs.helm.sh/developing_charts/] in order to use package management capabilities of HELM - a package manager for Kubernetes.

h3. Why this is important
It significantly simplifies the deployment and upgrades of Bitbucket Server/DC for the customer environments running in [Kubernetes|https://kubernetes.io/].
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server/DC on Kubernetes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When displaying a git repository within another repository, the Bitbucket Server user interface shows an "empty repository" (the page containing the instructions to push a new repository).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a git repository within an existing git repository
# Push the repository to Bitbucket Server
# Open the repository in the user interface

h3. Expected Results
The repository shows either an error or the displayable part of the repository.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bitbucket.log}} file:
{noformat}
WARN  [io-pump:thread-7] <username> @DEV2A4x508x167x0 gd3sg1 <ip address> "GET /projects/<project_slug>/repos/<repo_key>/browse HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.g.s.DefaultGitSubmoduleHelper Error looking up submodules for 'refs/heads/master' in '<project_slug>/<repo_key>[<repo_id>]'
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Having a nested Git repository is not supported.

h3.Workaround
To display the repository in the Bitbucket Server user interface, remove the nested Git repository.
fields.summary: "Error looking up submodules" warning is misleading in case of nested Git repositories

fields.description:
It would be really nice, if a green tick icon could be displayed over pull request author's avatar, just like it is when a reviewer approves the pull request.

See following image:

https://imgur.com/a/9unCOaW
fields.summary: Indicate self approval in list of pull requests

fields.description:
We are developing a commit policy app for Bitbucket that can verify branch names at creation/deletion (beside other features).

Options for formatting (e.g. by using HTML markup) the rejection messages are limited.

As you see in the screenshot below (from Bitbucket 5.11.1), each list element represents a veto with the summary and detailed message separated by a single space.

!https://bitbucket.org/midoriinc/downloads/downloads/bitbucket_branch_creation_rejection.png|width=901,height=446!

It would be great if we had more control over the formatting of this.

Same for branch deletion.

Actually, this problem is also present in case of merge checks:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-4428
fields.summary: Support for formatting rejection messages on branch creation/deletion

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The translation resource for "bitbucket.component.quick-search.terms.html" is broken.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch browser's language setting to Japanese
# Try searching code in quick search

 !bbs.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Corresponding to English text "Search for '__INPUT_TERM__' in code", Japanese form should render:

{code:none}
コード内で '__INPUT_TERM__' を検索
{code}


h3. Actual Results

The form renders:

{code:none}
__INPUT_TERM__&rsquoで検索; コードで
{code}


h3.Workaround

None. It needs to fix app/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/bitbucket-language-pack-ja_JP-5.9.0.rc2-201803170038.jar itself.
fields.summary: Japanese translation in quick search field is broken

fields.description: We work with pull requests from forks of mainline repositories and would find it extremely useful if Bitbucket Server supported something like GitHub's _Allow edits from maintainers_ (more infromation [here|https://blog.github.com/2016-09-07-improving-collaboration-with-forks/]). This would enable maintainers/owners of the mainline repositories to make minor changes to a pull request without having to wait for the submitter to make them.
fields.summary: add support for repository maintainers to edit pull requests

fields.description:
The documentation for the {color:blue}{{/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/{pullRequestId}/changes}}{color} endpoint has a contradiction, It reads:

bq. This is a paged API. This API can also be invoked via a user-centric URL when addressing repositories in personal projects.

But then is goes on to saying:

bq. Note: This resource is currently not paged. The server will return at most one page. The server will truncate the number of changes to either the request's page limit or an internal maximum, whichever is smaller. The start parameter of the page request is also ignored.

This is causing confusion for developers.

https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.11.1/bitbucket-rest.html?utm_source=%2Fstatic%2Frest%2Fbitbucket-server%2Flatest%2Fbitbucket-rest.html&utm_medium=301#idm46358292696832
fields.summary: Contradiction in the documentation of /rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/pull-requests/{pullRequestId}/changes

fields.description: the current Bitbucket log under a logged in user account is very confusing when you are inside a selected repo... IT LOOKS LIKE A RECYCLE BIN ICON. It took me 2 minutes to click on it today . Please change it !
fields.summary: bitbucket.org LOGO

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever the commit message is too long, hovering the commit hash in a pull request breaks the display of commit message tooltip.
h3. Environment
 * Replicated in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a commit whose message is at least 117 characters long.
 # Create a pull request that includes this commit.
 # Go to that pull request - "diff" section, select that commit using "Show diff of".
 # Hover the hash of that commit to see the commit message tooltip.

h3. Actual Results

The commit message tooltip is displayed offset / misaligned to the left:
 !5.11.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The commit message tooltip should be displayed like this (from 5.5.x):
 !5.5.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

There are no known workarounds thus far.
fields.summary: Long commit messages break display of commit message tooltip

fields.description:
It looks like when the document [Recommendations for running Bitbucket in AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/recommendations-for-running-bitbucket-in-aws-776640282.html] was written the [AWS m5 instance type|https://aws.amazon.com/pt/about-aws/whats-new/2017/11/introducing-amazon-ec2-m5-instances/] was not around.

The document must be updated in order to include m5 instance types.
fields.summary: Update documentation for including AWS m5 instance types

fields.description:
As a developer, I frequently go through pull requests and leave questions for the author. While I await these answers, there is no real way to indicate that I've otherwise completed the review. Marking something as "Approved" or "Needs Work" seems incorrect if all I really want is answers to questions of mine before I give final approval. 

I suggest adding a third option to the pull request status, called "Awaiting Response" (or maybe "Needs Information" or something similar) to indicate that the reviewer just wants the pull request author to answer some questions and not that there's obvious defects or problems in the code.
fields.summary: Add "Awaiting Response" option in Bitbucket pull request viewer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If you run the Bitbucket installer without admin privileges, It throws the generic error:
{quote}You do not have administrator rights to this machine.
 You will not be allowed to install Bitbucket as a service or listen on any port that's not permitted by your firewall
{quote}
However If you are upgrading on a server that already has a service installed, It will fail to set the BITBUCKET_USER variable in {{bin/set-bitbucket-user.sh}}, making it blank. Hence Bitbucket can run under different user accounts other than the service account.
h3. Suggested Solution

Have the installer detect the old BITBUCKET_USER variable, and determine if it requires admin privileges to update the new BITBUCKET_USER variable. Throw a more clear error if it cannot perform this update, or update the new variable with the old value.
h3. Why this is important

If you run Bitbucket with root, this can cause the {{/bb-data/log/bitbucket.pid}} file to be created under root. So if the user Bitbucket uses is rectified to use the service account and the {{bitbucket.pid}} file exists, Bitbucket cannot edit this file, causing Bitbucket to fail during startup. This file has to be manually removed with someone with root access. It can also create loss of data if other files are written. Example, files written while checking in code can become unaccessible, due to the user change. This could result in future checkins not being written.
h3. Workaround

There is a few possible workarounds.
 # Run the installer with administrator rights when upgrading.
 # Manually edit {{bin/set-bitbucket-user.sh}}
 # Modify the service to run with a {{sudo -u}}
fields.summary: Bitbucket installer upgrade can miss setting BITBUCKET_USER if not run with admin privileges.

fields.description:
After the latest Bitbucket update, macOS text replacements no longer work. This greatly interrupts my workflow, as we have a policy of indicating who reviewed a PR before it is merged. Now my shortcuts for my team members no longer function and I have to manually type the values in or copy/paste them from somewhere else.

As a more general policy, I would expect system-provided things like text replacement to work everywhere the user enters free-form text.
fields.summary: Latest Bitbucket update broke text replacements when merging

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket, 

 

As a owner or repository, i'm facing problems that how to prevent code to theft by admin(repository member who has read & write permission). 

 
 # How can we set login restriction to particular device only ? 
 ## can we set admin user(with read and write permission) to access code for push and pull from single device(computer)
 ## get quick email if they try to login and access the repository from other devices.
 # How to check their code access or download repository activity on owner repository account. with
 ## from which ip they downloaded code ? 
 ## Time 
 ## device name, browser information, location. 
 ## login activity(of my admin branch users)

 

In short, as a product owner how can i secure my code to theft. 

 

Thanks 

Dipen Desai
fields.summary: Track Or limit admin user to access code

fields.description:
Right now I can filter PRs by status, author, target branch and "I'm reviewing".

I would like to be able to filter by:
 # Title (Title ~ "some text")
 # # open tasks
 # Bamboo or Jenkins build status
 # Reviewer(s)
 # # approvals
 # Approved by
 # Date opened
 # Date updated
fields.summary: Advanced filters in Pull Request view

fields.description:
In the documentation for bitbucket.properties it's not clearly stated that bitbucket.properties overwrite the properties from web-interface, i.e. code search base URL

It would be good to have such note on the page [Bitbucket Server config properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-config-properties-776640155.html]
fields.summary: The documentation does not clear state that bitbucket.properties overwrites the settings in web interface

fields.description:
Team - I've a new customer using BitBucket for their source-code/ repository. They have >30 projects running parallel and each of them follows Dev -> Test -> UAT -> Prod release cycles.


Challenge is (due to parallel-developments on each projects) -
 * Sometime, feature-1(F1) was developed (Dev), Tested (Test) and UAT branch
 * Assume, Feature-2 (F2) was still on Dev branch
 * Business comes with urgent request to include feature-3 (F3) to be included in UAT

Many such scenarios, where-in features could not be properly tested before getting to UAT.

Could you help with some documentation/ best practices on how to manage parallel development projects ?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Parallel Development

fields.description: Markdown currently supports in-page links using a format along the lines of: [Topic 1](#Topic1) . However Bitbucket uses commonmark which doesn’t seem to support this. That causes adding links to content within the same page to be impossible. An implication here is that if we rely completely in markdown for project documentation, then we cannot create table of contents to help readers jump directly to certain sections of the document (read painful scrolling involved for longer documents)
fields.summary: Markdown in Bitbucket should support in-page links

fields.description: [TOC] has been around for a while now and it’s super useful to automagically generate table of contents for a document based on header information which markdown already has. Would be great to support [TOC] in Bitbucket
fields.summary: Bitbucket should support [TOC] for auto table of content generation in markdown

fields.description: The server is set to English (United States) as is in my account settings. We should use en-US rather than en-AU for Bitbucket localization. Or at least take the user’s browser locale into account.
fields.summary: Bitbucket mispells favorites as "favourites"

fields.description:
In bitbucket webhook push event payload, commit message is missing for toHash.

The payload is described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver059/event-payload-949255022.html?utm_campaign=in-app-help&utm_medium=in-app-help&utm_source=stash#Eventpayload-repositoryevents] in changes array.

This feature will help to put a appropriate build title/message in CI tool like Drone.io

We are expecting the message payload as changes[0].toHash.commit

The same feature is there in pull request event as pullRequest.title and pullRequest.description.
fields.summary: Webhook Push event payload is missing commit message for toHash

fields.description:
You can leave a comment linked to a specific line of code.

Or you can leave a message that is called "activity".

Problem: there is no distinction between comment and activity. To a branch to review, I can see "1 comment". I read through the whole code to review and notice no comment. Because it's not a comment per se; it's an activity.

 

Please be consistent with the terminology.
fields.summary: Make the difference between Comment and Activity

fields.description:
Hello,

 

As a team administrator user I want to have an option to prevent any repository creators from making a repository public

This would be accessible when creating a group or editing a group

Settings > Access Management > User Groups > Create/Edit

 

If this option is enabled the user in the group is presented with the "This is a private repository" option next to "Access level" on the create repository screen. If it is disabled the option is hidden or grayed out with the value set to private"

 

An example is provided below

 

Setting:

!image-2018-05-31-10-26-16-059.png!

 

If enabled:

!image-2018-05-31-10-31-01-172.png!

 

If disabled:

!image-2018-05-31-10-34-23-455.png!
fields.summary: Team Setting: Option to prevent repository creators from making a repository public

fields.description:
Current there are REST API endpoints to determine if a project has READ or WRITE access by default.

In order to determine if a project has NO ACCESS via a script, these endpoints have to be queried and if they both return FALSE, it can then be deduced that the project has NO ACCESS.

However the script would throw a false positive if a new default permission was introduced in future versions of the product.

h3.Proposed Fix

- Implement a REST API endpoint that returns the default permission for a given project
- Implement a NO ACCESS REST API endpoint
fields.summary: As a user it would be helpful to have a REST API endpoint that returns the default permission for a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user tries to merge a pull request with {{squash-ff-only}} strategy, and the merge fails due to the fact that target branch has another commit which doesn't exist on the source branch when the user wants to do a rebase -- the rebase button is then greyed out apparently due to merge conflict. However, when the pull request page is refreshed,  the rebase option is then available again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a repo on Bitbucket -- push in a new commit into the repo
* Checkout a new branch (develop), and then make some changes in the repo, and push it to the develop branch
* Checkout the master branch, perform some changes in the repo and push the changes into the *master* branch
* Create a pull request -- with develop branch as the *target* branch and master as the *source* branch
* Make sure the merge strategy is set to allow only the {{squash-ff-only}} strategy.
* Try to merge the pull request -- the pull request will fail to merge due to the repo is configured to require fast-forward merges and the target branch contains commits which are not present in the source branch.
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 1.15.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* Cancel the merge attempt
* Attempt to perform a rebase from the pull request

h3. Expected Results
Users will be able to perform a rebase

h3. Actual Results
The rebase option is greyed out after the merge attempt is cancelled
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 1.19.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refresh the pull request page. The rebase button should be available again after the page refresh
fields.summary: Rebase button in Bitbucket greyed out after failed pull request merged attempt

fields.description:
Hi,

I just wanted to check if it is possible to make a release public instead of the whole repository? If yes please guide me how to do that.

Best regards.
Vishrant
fields.summary: Making a release public

fields.description:
When viewing a file, a user should be able to hit a "history" button to view a file's history.

That used to exist in the older interface, but seems to have disappeared in the new interface.
fields.summary: Add file history back to interface

fields.description:
Add support for Git 2.17

https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.17.0.txt
fields.summary: Support Git 2.17

fields.description: Please add the capability of obtaining the creator of a repository and its creation date via REST API on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Please add the capability of obtaining the creator of a repository and its creation date via REST API

fields.description: Please make it possible to separate SSH from HTTP requests when monitoring via JMX so that SSH traffic, number of slow SSH requests, times taken and impacted repos can be monitored in real time.
fields.summary: Please add more granularity about SSH and HTTP requests that can be monitored via JMX

fields.description:
h3. Problem report:
Customers might have government requirements in order to make the login page display a textual warning that must be acknowledged by users before logging in.

This is currently only possible by customizing soy templates, however customizations are not supported.

h3. Suggestion:
Allow administrators to add a custom message to the login screen.

h3. Workaround:
There are no supported workarounds.
fields.summary: Login page: allow displaying a custom message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an external ldap user is added to or removed from a group it is not logged in the audit logs

h3. Environment
- user is located in an external ldap
- group is internal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- add a user to a group via the external ldap
- sync the ldap so the user is added to the internal group in Bitbucket Server
- remove the user from the group within the eternal ldap
- sync the ldap so the user is removed from the internal group in Bitbucket Server

h3. Expected Results
- We should see {{GroupMembershipsCreatedEvent}} & {{GroupMembershipDeletedEvent}} events in the audit logs after each ldap sync

h3. Actual Results
No events are logged
fields.summary: No audit events are raised when a user is added or removed from an internal group

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Nowadays it is only possible to add GPG keys using GPG itself and each user needs to do it, according to [Using GPG keys \- Add a GPG key to Bitbucket Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-gpg-keys-913477014.html#UsingGPGkeys-AddaGPGkeytoBitbucketServer].

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be much easier if it were possible to sync GPG keys from LDAP.

h3. Workaround
There are no known workarounds yet.
fields.summary: Allow importing GPG keys from LDAP

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For some repositories or branches, there is no need for formal review by a peer to get a branch merged so opening a pull request in this scenario is not needed. With current version of Bitbucket Server, the only solution for doing a direct merge without using PR is to do this out of Bitbucket Server, using a git client and merge command.

h3. Suggested Solution
We would like to be able to merge 2 branches from Bitbucket Server UI (like what's already available in Bitbucket cloud).

h3. Expected Outcome
When navigated to a given branch, a destination branch can be chosen and a merge button allows to merge between the 2 branches, and optionally delete the source branch (checkbox).
fields.summary: Allow merging branch from Bitbucket Server UI without PR

fields.description:
Hey,

In Github, there's a functionality to search file by its file name from anywhere. But in Bitbucket, i have to browse through the folders to find the file.

Well, we already have a search bar in side-menu. Just add a file search too there. It will be really easy for us!. Currently its not possible without any tweaks. 

I am browsing through multiple repositories for many files, so when i don't know the actual folder name but only a file name, this functionality will really help.

Please checkout the same functionalities by GitHub :D - wild file name search.

Thanks,
 Nikhil
fields.summary: Search Any File in repo by file name from sidebar

fields.description:
I want to be able to review a particular staff members productivity and see their commits..  the search doesn't include filtering on the author name which would be superuserful.  I have to go through hundreds of commits in the last few days just to find the ones by the person I'm interested in ?  

even if I could set the paging to like show 250 commits then I could use the browser control-f but I can't see a reason Bitbucket couldn't easily do this
fields.summary: be able to see commits by author or search or filter by author

fields.description: For German or Japanese users, the "Learn more" link for diagnostics (which can be seen by admin users at {{https://SERVER_URL/plugins/servlet/diagnostics/overview}}) is wrong because the link has been translated.
fields.summary: Link to diagnostics page does not work for German/Japanese users

fields.description:
Similar to JRASERVER-43422, the version of jQuery used (currently version 2.1.4) is vulnerable to jQuery issue [2432|https://github.com/jquery/jquery/issues/2432] (3rd party $.get() auto executes if content type is text/javascript) and [11974|https://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/11974] (parseHTML executes inline scripts like event handlers). Actual exploitation / impact to Bitbucket Server depends upon if & how the vulnerable code paths are used.


On a related note, http://research.insecurelabs.org/jquery/test/ can be used to check jQuery versions for issues.
fields.summary: The version of jQuery in use is vulnerable to several issues

fields.description:
If I create a default reviewer for John Doe, and set 'Approvals required' to 1, the user can delete that user from their pull request, but John Doe is still required to approve the pull request before it can be merged.

 

I suggest that any user specified in Default Reviewers where approvals required is not zero cannot be deleted, and that a small lock shows up next to their name to give feedback to the pull request creator.
fields.summary: Users can delete 'approval required' Default reviewers from pull request

fields.description: We enforce that feature branches be pushed under the user's Bitbucket slug. For example, my feature branch for this story might be judkinstv/BSERV-10871. I suggest you allow the Branching model inside project and repository settings to allow the use of *${BITBUCKET_USER_SLUG}* as an expandable option for feature branches.
fields.summary: Allow Branching Model prefix to use ${BITBUCKET_USER_SLUG}
